Ingest_LDD.name: Type_List
Ingest_LDD.comment: The Instrument Type List Dictionary provides a set of permissible values and their value meanings for use by the enumerated attribute type in the Instrument class. Modification History: 2019-11-14: First version delivered by the Instrument Type Steward Team.

DD_Attribute.name: type
DD_Attribute.definition: The type attribute provides a character string which uniquely identifies the object.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: An accelerometer measures acceleration -- rate of change of velocity -- in its own rest frame.
An altimeter measures distance above a surface.

Terminological_Entry.name: Lidar
Terminological_Entry.definition: A lidar measures distance to a target by illuminating it with a pulsed laser and measuring the time delay of the reflected signal.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: An atmospheric structure instrument measures one or more structural properties of an atmosphere. These properties may include -- but are not limited to -- pressure, temperature, density, wind speed, and wind direction.

Terminological_Entry.name: Meteorology
Terminological_Entry.definition: A meteorology instrument measures in situ meteorological conditions. These may include -- but are not limited to -- pressure, temperature, wind speed, and wind direction.

Terminological_Entry.name: Weather Station
Terminological_Entry.definition: A weather station is a suite of instruments that measures in situ meteorological conditions. These may include -- but are not limited to -- pressure, temperature, wind speed and wind direction.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: A camera is an optical instrument that captures a still image or a sequence of images on physical media.

Terminological_Entry.name: Imager
Terminological_Entry.definition: An imager detects and converts information into a digital image.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: A charged particle detector detects and/or counts charged particles, and provides information about particle properties and distributions.
A dust analyzer measures the size and/or energy distribution of dust particles.
An electric field instrument measures the direction and/or strength of an electric field.
A gamma ray detector is an instrument that detects gamma rays.
A gas analyzer measures the concentration of one or more species in a mixture of neutral gases.
A gravimeter measures gravitational acceleration.
An imager detects and converts information into a digital image.

Terminological_Entry.name: Camera
Terminological_Entry.definition: A camera is an optical instrument that captures a still image or a sequence of images on physical media.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: An imaging spectrometer acquires a spectrally-resolved image of an object or scene. Two axes of the image correspond to orthogonal spatial dimensions and the third corresponds to wavelength.
An interferometer superposes waves such that constructive and destructive interference results in patterns that can be interpreted as very small displacements at the signal source.
A Langmuir probe consists of one or more electrodes used to determine in-situ plasma properties such as density and temperature from the measured potentials and currents.
A lidar measures distance to a target by illuminating it with a pulsed laser and measuring the time delay of the reflected signal.

Terminological_Entry.name: Altimeter
Terminological_Entry.definition: An altimeter measures distance above a surface.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: A magnetometer measures the direction and/or strength of a magnetic field.
A mass spectrometer sorts and counts atoms, ions, and/or molecules based on their masses.
A meteorology instrument measures in situ meteorological conditions. These may include -- but are not limited to -- pressure, temperature, wind speed, and wind direction.

Terminological_Entry.name: Weather Station
Terminological_Entry.definition: A weather station is a suite of instruments that measures in situ meteorological conditions. These may include -- but are not limited to -- pressure, temperature, wind speed and wind direction.

Terminological_Entry.name: Atmospheric Structure Instrument
Terminological_Entry.definition: An atmospheric structure instrument measures one or more structural properties of an atmosphere. These properties may include -- but are not limited to -- pressure, temperature, density, wind speed, and wind direction.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: A microphone converts sound waves into electrical signals.
A microscope magnifies objects that are too small to be seen with the naked eye.
A mutual impedance probe measures in situ bulk plasma properties at radio frequencies.
A nephelometer measures the concentration of suspended (cloud) particulates.
A neutral particle detector detects and/or counts neutral particles, and provides information about particle properties and distributions.
A neutron detector detects and/or counts neutrons.
A photometer measures the intensity of electromagnetic radiation over a wavelength range at infrared and shorter wavelengths.
A polarimeter measures the polarization of an electromagnetic wave.
A radar transmits an electromagnetic wave, then measures amplitude, time delay, frequency shift, phase shift, and/or polarization of the echo from a distant target.
A radio receiver detects the information in propagating electromagnetic waves collected by an antenna.
Radio science is the use of active and/or passive electromagnetic waves to probe the environment.
A radiometer measures radiant flux (power) of electromagnetic radiation.
A relaxation sounder determines the properties of a plasma by actively probing at radio frequencies at and near the plasma frequency.
A seismometer measures ground motions such as might be caused by earthquakes, volcanic eruptions, or explosions.

A spacecraft sensor captures information on the status or physical condition of a spacecraft or its components. These may include, but are not limited to, temperatures, mechanical friction, currents, voltages, etc.
A spectrometer measures an energy spectrum.
A spectrum analyzer measures the properties of photons, charged particles, or electrical signals as a function of frequency or energy.
A sub-surface tool probes the upper few meters of a surface to infer its properties. Examples include (but are not limited to) drills and penetrators.
A surface tool physically probes a surface to infer its properties. Examples include (but are not limited to) brush and deployment systems.
A temperature sensor measures temperature.
A weather station is a suite of instruments that measures in situ meteorological conditions. These may include -- but are not limited to -- pressure, temperature, wind speed and wind direction.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: A wind tunnel is used to study the effects of air moving past solid objects.

DD_Attribute.name: subtype
DD_Attribute.definition: The subtype attribute provides additional nuance or clarity to the type attribute.

DD_Class.name: Type_List
DD_Class.definition: The Type List class provides a list of values and their value meanings.
